sectionText: For up-to-date information about statistics course registration, please see our registration page: https://illinois.edu/blog/view/7118.  TOPIC: Stochastic Processes  Description: A stochastic process is a random process that represents the evolution of some system over time. The course is aimed at advanced undergraduate and beginning graduate students. Topics include discrete-time Markov chains, random walks, continuous-time Markov chains, Poisson processes, birth-and-death processes, renewal processes, queues, Brownian motion (Wiener process), and Ito's lemma.
sectionNotes: Restricted to Statistics or Statistics & Computer Science major(s). Restricted to Undergrad - Urbana-Champaign.
